forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 5pm. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 60. South wind 13 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 40 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 11pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South southwest wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The dawn in Downtown San Francisco carries with it an unmistakable chill, intermingled with a veil of looming rain clouds that blanket the horizon. The city, at this hour, feels hushed, awaiting the arrival of the rain forecasted to sweep through before the early evening. The high, gently brushing sixty degrees serves as a reminder of spring’s tender grip, yet the south wind nudges with a brisk insistence, hinting at the strength of the elements around us. 

The charm of San Francisco maintains its stature, even when draped in this damp guise. As the clouds gather, one might detect hints of mist creeping over the hills, forming a soft marine layer. The vistas, typically vibrant, are muted under this shroud, creating an atmosphere that is palpably contemplative and slightly somber. For those stepping out, a raincoat accompanied by a sturdy pair of shoes is advisable—each step becomes an adventure, whether traversing city streets or seeking refuge in a cozy café. 

Given the weather's unpredictability, an afternoon stroll through one of the city’s lush parks or a visit to a local museum would be delightful explorations. If you find yourself indoors, perhaps indulge in a book or a warm cup of coffee, letting the rhythm of raindrops become your backdrop for reflection.
